submodules.title: Task Management UI
submodules.description: A clean and intuitive interface that allows users to view, add, and manage their tasks effortlessly. The UI will include input fields for new tasks, a list view for existing tasks, and buttons for actions like adding or deleting tasks.

submodules.title: Task Completion Feature
submodules.description: Users can mark tasks as completed using a checkbox. This feature will visually differentiate completed tasks from active ones, enhancing user experience and task organization.

submodules.title: Responsive Design
submodules.description: The application will be designed to work seamlessly across various devices and screen sizes, ensuring that users can manage their tasks on desktops, tablets, and smartphones without any loss of functionality.

submodules.title: Theme Toggle
submodules.description: An optional feature that allows users to switch between light and dark themes, providing a personalized experience and improving usability in different lighting conditions.

submodules.title: Task Filtering
submodules.description: An optional feature that enables users to filter tasks based on their status: all, active, or completed. This will help users focus on specific tasks and improve their productivity.

submodules.title: LocalStorage Management
submodules.description: Implementation of localStorage to save tasks persistently on the user's device. This ensures that tasks remain available even after the browser is closed or refreshed, providing a reliable user experience.

submodules.title: Data Structure Design
submodules.description: Designing a structured format for storing task data, including task titles, completion status, and timestamps. This will facilitate efficient data retrieval and manipulation.

submodules.title: Task Synchronization
submodules.description: If future enhancements include cloud synchronization, this submodule will handle the logic for syncing tasks across devices, ensuring that users have access to their tasks wherever they are.

submodules.title: Unit Testing
submodules.description: Developing unit tests for individual components and functions to ensure that each part of the application works as intended. This will help catch bugs early in the development process.

submodules.title: User Acceptance Testing
submodules.description: Conducting testing sessions with real users to gather feedback on usability and functionality. This will help identify areas for improvement and ensure that the application meets user needs.

submodules.title: Cross-Browser Testing
submodules.description: Testing the application across different web browsers to ensure consistent performance and appearance. This will help identify and resolve any compatibility issues.

submodules.title: Hosting Setup
submodules.description: Configuring a hosting environment for the application, ensuring that it is accessible to users. This includes selecting a hosting provider and setting up the necessary infrastructure.

submodules.title: Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)
submodules.description: Implementing CI/CD pipelines to automate the deployment process, ensuring that updates and new features can be released quickly and reliably.

submodules.title: User Guide
submodules.description: Creating comprehensive documentation for end-users, detailing how to use the application, including features, troubleshooting tips, and FAQs.

submodules.title: Developer Documentation
submodules.description: Providing technical documentation for developers, including code structure, API references, and guidelines for contributing to the project.
